replies.msg:
Gini Wijnaldum on Porto: “The game will not be decided in one leg, it’s over two legs. In the first leg you must make sure you have a good result for the second leg. That’s what we have to do - you know you can’t win it in one leg.”

Wijnaldum: “I don’t think it matters where you’re playing first, you must get a result. I think if you score away it’s already a good result because it counts more than when you score at home.”

Wijnaldum: “I think Porto’s also going to be difficult. They’ve reached the next stage of this tournament so we have to be aware of how good they can be. Everyone who’s reached this stage I think is a good team.”

Wijnaldum: “I think it’s a good group, a good team. I don’t know a lot of them but we’re going to analyse them and I think as a team we’re going to know them better.”

Celtic boss Brendan Rodgers is the best British manager working in football right now, according to Jamie Carragher.

Carragher: "He at times is ridiculed, even sometimes by Liverpool fans on social media, ‘oh Brendan Rodgers has only done this’, ‘Klopp’s only done that’ as if Brendan Rodgers is the worst manager they’ve ever seen at Liverpool."

Carragher: “Rodgers came closer than anyone to winning a league title."

Porto are waiting on a late fitness test for key defender Ivan Marcano ahead of their Champions league last 16 clash with Liverpool on Wednesday night.

Top scorer Vincent Aboubakar is also not at 100% and also only took part in limited training yesterday although midfielder Andre Andre seems to be winning his battle for fitness, says @AndyK_LivNews

There is no prospect of Nathaniel Clyne taking part in Liverpool's tie at the Estadio do Dragao on Wednesday night but he will travel on with the team for further warm weather training at a four-day camp in Marbella, writes @AndyK_LivNews
